newsitem.title: UK: Newcastle losses were 21.7 mln stg last year - paper.
newsitem.headline: Newcastle losses were 21.7 mln stg last year - paper.

text.p: UK football club Newcastle United, which plans to float on the stock market this spring, incurred a loss of 21.7 million pounds last year before interest and tax, in excess of the most pessimistic forecasts, The Times reported.

The losses were due to an expenditure of 27.6 million pounds on new players and was revealed in a research note published by NatWest Markets, which is financial adviser to the flotation, the newspaper said.
The club writes off all transfer fees at the time they are paid and its results will be hit in particular by the 15 million pounds spent on striker Alan Shearer last summer.
The club hopes to raise 40-50 million pounds through the sale of new shares and said operating profit in the year to end-July 1996 was 5.9 million pounds.
NatWest forecasts Newcastle will will make a profit of 7.6 million pounds in the six months to January 31, the paper said.
